intro: Aspidogyne bidentifera, commonly known as the two-toothed aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Aspidogyne bidentifera is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
